title: Why are email-addresses always in lower-case? - Quora

response.answer_text: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5321.txt: The local-part of a mailbox MUST BE treated as case sensitive. Therefore, SMTP implementations MUST take care to preserve the case of mailbox local-parts. In particular, for some hosts, the user "smith" is different from the user "Smith". However, exploiting the case sensitivity of mailbox local-parts impedes interoperability and is discouraged. Mailbox domains follow normal DNS rules and are hence not case sensitive. So in practice e-mail addresses are case-insensitive. Just try with yourself.

They are not always in lowercase. In fact, they are case insensitive.  FoO@ExAmPlE.oRg is the same as fOO@exampLe.OrG The reason you see them most often in lowercase is because that way there is no need to hit the caps key.
